Reviews.Title: “the nicest staff ever .”
Reviews.Author: ahmed_m111
Reviews.Content: the suite was ok to the value of money , staff are very great , breakfast was poor and resturant is small , the hotel main entrance is low and stairs are narrow so be carefull with children .

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy & traditional”
Reviews.Author: ciftcis
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very much up to my expectations, It is located right in the center of the touristic attractions which is a must see for the travelers visiting Istanbul. the rooms are fairly big & clean & the hotel staff are very friends kind of like one big happy family atmosphere. The view on the terrace where breakfast is served is amazing. I would highly advise all types of travelers: family, couple, business to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wei Ken P
Reviews.Content: At first i have some problem with the booking. I book the room about a month before i departed to istanbul, few day before i flew to istanbul i send a email and reconfirmed my airport pickup. They told me the hotel is fully booked. Then the staff suggested me to stay 2 night in St sophia and 2 nights in Sultanahmet. After 2 night of stay in St sophia, Mr Meetin ( the manager/ owner) called up a taxi and transfer us to sultanahmet without me asking it. Mr Meetin is very helpful and nice. I stayed in the Cappadocia Suite on the ground floor, the room is very big and equipped with kitchen amenities and fridge. The best part is the toilet has a hamam and the water pressure is very strong for a good shower. Breakfast served in the roof top terrace with ham,cheese,cake,olive,jam,fruits,coffee,tea,bread,eggs. Overall the place is clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Chiara D
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location is incredibly convenient. Secondly the hotel is clean and, most important, the staff is nice and friendly, willing to help and assist the tourist. Nice terrace with view over the Marmara sea where breakfast is served. The price is reasonable and totally acceptable for a clean and central room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: zara72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Anatolia suite for 10 night with my husband and 2 teenage kids.The best part of this hotel is the location where all the place of interests are within walking distance. The room is equipped with the basic necessities , little kitchen, 1 king size bed and 2 single beds which is very comfortable for a small family. The owner and the staffs were very helpful and cooperative and they arranged for us the transport from/to the airport. The breakfast is ok but I think they should at least rotate the menu. Overall we had a very nice stay at this hotel. from, zara72,malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Fine place with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tek K
Reviews.Content: First off, they had a slight problem with over booking and we were asked to stay at the St. Sophia hotel for three days, which was rather noisy. The front desk feels like it is almost in your room! But we finally were taken to the other location near the Blue Mosque. Much quieter and the room was very nice. One thing you cannot fault is the staff. They were always polite and accommodating and always took the time to help. For our first trip to Istanbul, the whole trip was made so enjoyable by this wonderful staff. The hotel near the Blue Mosque is very quiet, clean, with a nice breakfast and very reasonable in price. We were picked up at the airport, an added bonus. I give it 5 stars and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay at..”
Reviews.Author: stephan f
Reviews.Content: in october we have been staying at anatolia suites for one week. beautiful. the rooms are comfortable and clean and staff is very helpful. the breakfast-terrace at the top of the hotel offers a great view over a part of bosporus and marmara-sea. the hotel is in walking distance to great bazar, topkapi and sultan mosque. if we visit istanbul once more we will stay at anatolia suites.

Reviews.Title: “they've stolen money, the others is ok.....”
Reviews.Author: Kattiv
Reviews.Content: Initially we had to stay in the other hotel, but they moved us to Anatolia Suits. They gave us big room but with the wall view and in the morning we got up from the noise from big energy tank. The owner and the staff was very polite and helpfull. breakfast is ok. Unfortunatly we leave part of our money in safe, and next morning was in hurry to got to the aiport in time (we had a flight to Cappadoccia). On the way we understood that forgot pocket with money and some documents and visit cards in safe box, called to the hotel and agreed that they brought the poket to the aiport in a week. We passed the key from the safe via driver. In a week. when we came back to Istanbul, the owner brought us the pocket - and we find there less 150 dollars and no business cards.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying at”
Reviews.Author: Saman S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Anatolia suites for four nights. I found the place to be very good and clean with basic amenities like air conditioning, clean toilets, good rooms etc and the management was very cooperative and helpful. The best part about Anatolia suites is the location, its a two minute walk to Sultan mosque and is located in the centre of Sultan Ahmet meaning that the tram, bus and taxi services are within reach and also the topkapi place and the grand bazar are at a walking distance. After my stay my parents, my parents in law and my brother in law have also stayed there at different occasions and were equally impressed. If you are looking for convenience and comfort, look no further. Highly recommended. Saman Saad Pakistan

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vlad C
Reviews.Content: A very nice and clean hotel located very close to the tourist and historical attractions of Istanbul. I had a business trip but due to good positioning of the hotel we managed to visit the main historical sites. I recommend this hotel perfectly preserved old architecture. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful ... ask Salih, an excellent guide.

Reviews.Title: “August 25 till 30 2011”
Reviews.Author: Wail F
Reviews.Content: Location is great...You are very close to Sultan Ahmat...night life is very nice for the family...Hotel is very very very clean...I enjoyed thier simple breakfast with great veiw...The hotel staff is extremly friendly...

Reviews.Title: “very good place to enjoy istambul”
Reviews.Author: jose r
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 2 kids stayed for 5 nights. the location is perfect. quiet zone next to the main touristic attractions. the "apartment" is quite well equipped. you have all necessary: little kitchen, kings size bed and 2 single beds. very comfortable. 2tvs. breakfast is correct in a nice terrace where you can see the sea. reception staff will explain you everything you need about the city to have an unforgettable stay. tip...tamara restaurant next to anatolia is great i will repeat i we come back to istambul jose luis roldÃ¡n Barcelona Spain

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and comfortable place in which all I need ..”
Reviews.Author: silentsteps
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel and I am relieved a lot, and that I will stay where I visited Istanbul for later..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal with family and on the doorstep of all the great sites.”
Reviews.Author: Brounie
Reviews.Content: The suite was an ideal set up for traveling with children. The kitchenettes was adequate. There is a huge selection of eateries on your doorstep to cater to all budgets. Breakfasts were great on the open air balcony, nice fresh selection. The staff could not be more helpful, nothing was to much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: mlbk888
Reviews.Content: Location - smacked right in Sultanahmet within walking distance to all the major sights like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Boutiques and specialty shops right at hotel's doorsteps. Amenities - there is no lift but the helpful staff will assist with luggage. All rooms have kitchenette with basic utensils for preparing simple meals. Separate living area with extra bed if needed. There is a laptop in the reception for guests' use. Service - great service provided by Kara and his staff. They assist with bookings for shows, tours, dinners, airport transfers, directions to places of interest etc - just ask and he will try his best to oblige. Katra recommended a very good fish restaurant for dinner on our last night and went the extra mile of walking us to the restaurant and ensuring that we were properly seated. This is what I call great service. We absolutely enjoyed our stay at Anatolia Suites and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great central apartments”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Anatolia Suites for 4 nights over the Easter long weekend. The rooms are comfortably sized and are very clean. It's always nice to have a fridge and kitchenette in order to not always have to eat in restaurants. The breakfast that is served is modest but does the job. The great thing about the hotel is the location - within very easy walking distance of all the main Istanbul Old City attractions. Also easy walking distance to both Sultanahmet and Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ tram stops. One negative - hotel is not very soundproof so if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. Naturally this depends more on who the guests are rather than the hotel itself, but positives overcome the negatives in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: vkovr
Reviews.Content: This New Year holiday we spend in Anatolia Suites. It is situated in the heart of the historic part of Istanbul - Sultanahmet. Prior to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other attractions are within walking distance. Hotel street is quiet, without traffic and tourists. The hotel itself is small, pleasant. Each room has its own name. We had a triple Cappadocia: the ground floor, with a little hammam and garden. The rooms have a mini-kitchen: electric cooker, kettle, fridge, sink, dishes. So if you do not have time for breakfast or have no desire to go to the cafe, you can cook in the room and drink tea. (Products can be purchased at supermarkets or near the Grand Bazaar). Breakfast (till 10-30 -11-00) is included. Dining room was placed on the top floor with stunning views of the countryside and some view of the Bosphorus. Staff in Anatolia Suites are very friendly, welcoming us not only met at the airport and took a taxi to our hotel, but then made a free transfer back, although this was not provided. In general, we can recommend as an inexpensive and pleasant hotel, conveniently located, unassuming. Small minus - no elevator. We, however, it did not bother))) We had a very good time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: St_PetersburgMaria
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six days trip to Istanbul with my hasband and grown-up daughter. It was a real success in all aspects. And most of it was due to the right choice of the place to stay. The location is perfect, very close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, nice quiet streets around, no cars or trams, or crouds of tourists. Arasta bazaar and interesting shops with tipical beautiful things to buy very close, much more quiet shopping, than in other parts of Istanbul. A street full of different cafes and restaurants nearby. Anatolia Suites is perfect for a small family, if you are more than a couple and you want to have more than just one hotel room. And it is much cheaper than taking two hotel rooms. They have two small two-rooms apartments on each floor. We had the one on the third floor with a sea view. Probably that was the best. A bathtub in each suite is really a rare thing for the centrally situated hotels in big cities, in Istanbul as well. Breakfast is simple and nice, and on the upper terrace with a beautiful view on the Marmara sea and Bosphorus. I would recommend going to the Marmara sea embankment which is close, and is not much mentioned in guide books. On a sunny day it is so nice to have lunch at on of the restaurants near the fish market, where they make fish you have just chosen. The people who work at the Anatolia suites are most friendly and helpful. Our parents are planning to go to Istanbul. We will definitely accomodate them in Anatolia Suites.

Reviews.Title: “sehr empfehlenswert”
Reviews.Author: BubuDickmann
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in Anatolia Suites. The room on the top floor was spacious enough (it might get hot in summer-time),good shower in shower-cabin, terrace with partly view on the Bosporus, everything very clean and well taken care of. Very friendly stuff, sufficient breakfast-buffet and for the 40 Euro per night definetely recomendable. The suites, also in their annexe St.Sophia are interesting if you are more then two persons.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: HammadIstanbul
Reviews.Content: I went through loads of websites looking for a suitable place to stay in Istanbul when I found Anatolia Suites. I went to Istanbul with my parents, wife and 20 month old baby and we booked the Espheus Suite. At the airport we were met by a hotel representative and we had our own shuttle bus to the hotel (more like a mini bus, very comfortable and loads of room!). A warm and friendly welcome from the owner (Zeki) awaited us, who was more than happy to guide us through the city, as it was our first visit to Istanbul. There was a great view of the Sea from both of our rooms and a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque from the Roof Terrace. We wanted an apartment in order that we could all stay together and this suite was ideal for us. The room was bigger than any hotel room you would pay for at this rate so for value for money this apartment in unbeatable. It was clean and the breakfast was more than adequate. The staff are all very friendly and very helpful (especailly Noori) who always helped us as did Zeki the owner. I am planning another trip to Istnabul and would definetly recommend Anatolia Suites to my friends and family. It was intersting to hear other guests who had stayed at Anatolia Suites on several occassions\before, which proves that they are very good value for money so why pay for an expensive Hotel which will probably have a smaller room, when you can get an apartment with a fridge, cooking utensils, two double beds and bath and is only 200 metres from the Blue Mosque. The location wwas great, in the middle of sultanhmet but it was in quiet road but still close to shops in order that you can buy daily fruit etc. It is rare to find places such as this apartment and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: cupcup
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location, clean rooms and excellent staff. The hotel is good value for money, we travel with two young children and having the extra room with out the extra cost is a bonus. The location is fantastic, 5 mins walk to blue mosque, St Sofia and 10 mins to Topkapi Palace. Loads of restaurants and cafes near by. And the hotel staff we fantastic...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms / Great location”
Reviews.Author: O555
Reviews.Content: Very safe choice in Sultanahmet, minutes on foot from the Blue Mosque. One street away from the busier tourist strip (quieter at night). Stayed with two small children, and found the staff extremely helpful and considerate. Staff helped booked transportation and called at six pm to see if anything was needed before the kids went to bed for the night. Breakfast is basic, but enough to get a good start on the day. Bathroom was newly renovated, and hot water was always at the ready. Spacious apartment layout. No trouble recommending this place, especially if you have kids or want to fit more than 2 in a room for the price of a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ctalusan
Reviews.Content: Location is very good - convenient as it is very near Sultanahmet Square. Anatolia Suites is like a home away from home. The staff are very helpful - Mehmet (night staff) ordered grilled chicken for us although its already very late in the night - my son's comment - "this is the best grilled chicken i ever had!". We stayed in aspendos suites and it is really very roomy - 5 people can comfortably fir into it! Very clean and quiet! I love the breakfast place at the terrace! Zeki - the owner is very accommodating and a very nice person! He went out of his way to even assist us with our booked tours! We definitely recommend this hotel especially for families!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: readyforadvisor
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 2 adults and 2 young adults in a family. Family owned, renovated building with seven suites. We stayed in the Ephesus Suite. No elevator and three floors of steps. No problem for us. It provided us a quiet place (mostly to crash and sleep) after busy days of sightseeing. Private queen bedroom with two pull out beds in the living area with mini sink and refrigerator. A little tight with 4 adults but clean, simple and comfortable. Continental breakfast on rooftop patio. Nice views of the Marmara from the rooftop patio, where we had our daily Continental breakfast and our BYOB cocktails. 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Very good location for reasonable walks to all the important sites in the Old City. Spent 5 nights here, met our expectations and very satisfied with our with stay and value. Deniz was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights after a Turkey tour, and 2 nights in were asked to move to another hotel even though we had booked a suite months ahead. Apparently overbooked and they decided we were the only ones who could move. We were not happy about this and ended up after much stuffing around moving to a much smaller room with no kitchen. That said we enjoyed the excellent position for easy walking to the main attractions. Just check and confirm your exact room type before you arrive. Easy to do off the web site.Staff were helpful and we would still recommend this Apartment Hotel. Before this we had stayed at the Crown Plaza (Old City) and you couldnt swing a cat in the room and the aircons were not working even after complaining.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simmin
Reviews.Content: Good value Hotel in a nice area near the Blue Mosque and other cultural attractions. Hotel suite clean and comfortable although a lot of stairs to the top floor where we were situated. Turkish breakfast good and staff very helpful. Yes the call to prayer is quite loud and for those who complain about this whilst staying anywhere in Turkey yet alone Istanbul, what do you expect, it's a Muslim country. I would recommend this hotel as good value for money in a safe and interesting district.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: mina0522
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Istanbul for a couple of nights and I struck gold with Anatolia Suites for its location, quite unexpectedly. You hear of places being 'within walking distance' but you always take it with a grain of salt. I stayed in a room on the top floor and as I walked out to the hotel terrace and turned around, the minarets of the Blue Mosque were straight ahead of me. The hotel is situated on a quaint cobbled street and it is a mere minutes' walk to go to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Basilica Cistern..and then some. My room was very comfortable, clean and modern and I was not left needing anything. The hotel had the feel of a cozy B&B due to the fact that the staff were extremely helpful, courteous and friendly. Again, I have to mention the location.....it could not be better, seriously ! Istanbul is a hustle-bustle place so to be able to just wander out and hit so many places in one go is a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good apartments, good value”
Reviews.Author: AJCCSIC
Reviews.Content: I chose Anatolia Suites for our 3rd stay in Istanbul as we were ready for a little more independence and autonomy this time. The location is spot on - a very short walk from Arasta Carsisi and Sultanahmet Camii in one direction, Kucuk Aya Sofya in another, or Akbiyik Caddesi if you take a left and follow the back streets. The apartments are clean and roomy - ours would easily have accommodated 4, and servicing is good. Breakfast is sparse and you will probably end up buying your own food from the shop on the corner. However, do not expect more independence or freedom to give friends a cup of tea at your place if you do chose Anatolia Suites - you won't get it, despite being a fully paid up adult. I invited someone in for tea and this was followed by a member of staff checking the kettle to see if it was hot (i.e. had we really used it or was there some dark mystery?). So think of this as a hotel with a bit more room and you have it. If you want to be treated like a grown up - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kjancheh
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my sister and brother in law to Istanbul in early June. Before leaving the United States I researched available hotels and suites in the Sultanahmet area because we wanted to be close to all the historic sites. I chose Anatolia Suites because of one review about its cleanliness and hospitable staff. Well, I should say that I am very happy with my choice. The suite is comprised of two rooms, a big bathroom and a little kitchenette. The rooms are very clean with all the amenities you need, including telephone, flat screen TV, safe and airconditioning in all the rooms. The staff are very kind and helpful. The place has a homely feeling to it, plus the fact that it is close to everything. I would recommend it highly to those who do not care for big luxurious hotel living while traveling to historic cities and would like to have a feel for local hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay. sejour agreable.”
Reviews.Author: fakhrbrandt
Reviews.Content: Travelling with two kids, I was more than happy to stay in Anatolia suits, not only for the great location, but also for efficient, friendly and welcoming staff. quiet neighborhood, 10 minutes walk to many historic sites in Sultanahmet, close to shops, bazaar, seaside, and transport facilities. Simple and neat. View to Marmara sea from the terrace. M.Brandt

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul: Best experience at Anatolia Suites”
Reviews.Author: denizin
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go to Turkey and especially Istanbul for a long time and I wasnt sure about where to stay. I was looking more for an authentic experience rather than a usual hotel stay and I came across Anatolia Suites website, and each suite is a 1 bdr room apt (bigger then my NYC studio!)- one of them even has a turkish bath within the suite! The best part was - the rates beat hotel room prices! It got better when I got there, the hotel is very centrally located walking distance within a few blocks of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and many more museums etc. I had heard of Turkish Hospitality but got to live it first hand here, the staff was incredibelly nice and accomadating. The hotel itself was impecabbly clean. I recommend everybody who is planning a visit to Istanbul to stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Anatolia Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Sultanahmet Mahallesi, Ogul Sokak No:8, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
